column2: §YOAS Unity§! measures how united the members states within the §YOrganisation of African States§! currently are. The higher this is, the closer the member states are to unifaction. Once unity hits zero however, the §YOAS§! will most likely §RDissolve§!\nThe effect tooltip of this decision will show what the current unity level of the OAS is
§!The §YUnity of the OAS§! is higher than §G10§!§b

The OAS grew out of a unifaction effort between the Senegal-Soudan project of the Mali Federation, Ghana and Guinea. Initially this was based on the deep friendship between the presidents of the three Nations Kwame Nkrumah of Ghana, Ahmed Sékou Touré of Guinea and Modibo Keïta of Mali. Over time this organisation grew greater than the orignal relationship and was joined by many members of the Monrovia and Casablanca Groups in a attempt to build a unified West-African State. However the Mali Federation has remained in existance as a major part of the organisation and stress is forming between the old Senegal-Soudan union and the rest of the OAS. Should we fully integrate the remains of Mali into the OAS, or do we keep Mali as the core of the organisation?
If Mali is preserved as an instituion, then if the OAS ever disolves we will then become the §YMali Federation§!§b
Sankara Coups the Upper Volta Government
Perhaps we could keep the name
The Organisation of African States has collapsed and we are now fully independant. Our piority now is to secure our place in the world without the OAS.
We shall use Songhai, the name of the past.
West Africa is where we are, and shall be our name.
We should keep the name we started with.

The Orgnisation of African States was a dream to unite the divided and exploited region of Western Africa into a federal union of states. And now that dream has been forfilled through hard work and centralisation efforts. Let us now look towards the bright future of what was once called a Dark Continient.
Samuel Doe Coups the Liberian Government

The UN gave us the mandate to rebuild Nigeria. This intervention however bogged down into infighting leaving the OAS in defacto control of only a corridor to the capital. However now we have centralised control over the entirety of Nigeria its time to reestablish the republic as a new member of the OAS.

§YECOWAS§!, or the Economic Community of West African States, was founded in 1975 as a part of a move to bring the economies of the OAS together. If §YECOWAS§! proves itself to be successful to the constituent states it will increase the §YUnity of the OAS§!

After the loss to Bifara and the following series of coups, the Republic of Nigeria was close to collapsing. The OAS intervened, and with the backing of the UN established a Nigerian Mandate under OAS command in the capital of Abuja. This intervention quickly decended into a long drawn out conflict leaving the OAS coalition control of only a strip of land to the capital. This has harmed the crediblity of the OAS forces, and as the 1980s dawns the OAS needs to bring this conflict to a close to regain its image as the leading power in africa.
Centenial of the foundation of the OAS
